ENGINEERING TECH

SUMMARY

Dedicated team player with extensive knowledge of electrical engineering concepts and a creative aptitude for new product development.

C++ , SQL, Verilog , VHDL, MatLab, PSpice, LTSpice, PowerWorld , LabView, Windows 2000/XP, Web Design, MS Office (Excel, Project, PowerPoint and Word), and HTML programming.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Metrology Engineer

Location: Golden Valley, MN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity

The future is what you make it!

At Honeywell Advanced Connected Sustainability Technologies (ACST), our outstanding team of thinkers, innovators, and doers help make the future. We build environments and technologies that meet our customers' needs. The groundbreaking scientists, engineers, and professionals that make up our nimble group have the agility of a start-up backed with the power and investment of Honeywell.

Join a team with expertise in physics, cryogenics, complex control systems, cyber security, and more to incubate novel technologies that shape the future! #futureshaper

Honeywell’s ACST team is seeking a Metrology Engineer for our Golden Valley, MN location.

Citizenship Required: United States CitizenshipClearance Required: Yes; you must either currently have or be able to obtain and maintain an active U.S. Government security clearanceTelecommute: No - Teleworking not available for this positionTravel Required: Some travel required – 10%Relocation Assistance: Relocation assistance may be available.

Are you ready to help us make the future?

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?

In addition to a competitive salary, leading-edge work, and developing solutions side-by-side with dedicated experts in their fields, Honeywell ACST employees are eligible for a comprehensive benefits package. This package includes employer subsidized Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance; Short-Term and Long-Term Disability; 401(k) match, Flexible Spending Accounts, Health Savings Accounts, EAP, and Educational Assistance; Parental Leave, Paid Time Off (for vacation and/or personal business), and 12 Paid Holidays. A relocation package is available to support your move to one of our locations. This role is also eligible for a discretionary incentive bonus in addition to base pay.

Your Role Will Include

Support the design and development of integrated systems with overall metrology solutions being a key componentDesign, develop, calibrate, and execute metrology platforms for cryogenic systems, testing, and verificationCollaborate with engineers and scientists while performing laboratory experiments, gathering and analyzing data to verify solutions meet key customer objectives and overall system operation needsUnderstand and mitigate experimental uncertainties via statistical tools, techniques, and methodologiesCreate and communicate scientific documentationPartner with project leadership for overall project execution

Us Citizenship Requirements

Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements.

You Must Have

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution in a technical discipline such as the sciences, technology, engineering or mathematicsMinimum 5 years’ experience in metrology, engineering, or related disciplineU.S. citizenship to obtain and maintain a security clearance

We Value

We value candidates who may have one or more of the following skills:

Masters Degree in statistics, material science, physics, engineering, or related disciplineStrong record of publication in the area of demonstrated development of measurement tools and techniques for very low temperature applicationsExperience in calibration, data acquisition, analysis, variability, documentation5+ years experience with increasing responsibility in the area of metrologyProven leadership, mentorship, collaboration, and communication skills

This role will remain open until an offer is accepted.

#ACST

Additional Information

JOB ID: HRD227746Category: EngineeringLocation: 1985 Douglas Drive North, Suite Corp ACST,Golden Valley,Minnesota,55422,United StatesExemptMust be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements.

Global (ALL)

Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
